Carl,"2011-01-02T17:01:20.923Z","Mandalorian Battle Pack","This is my second Star Wars set of 2011, and overall I am pleased.

Minifigures


Just like the Clone Trooper Battle Pack of 2011, all the minifigures in this set are unique to it. However unlike the Clone Trooper Battle Pack, there is only one type of minifigure in this set: the Mandalorian Death Watch Soldier. Although this does mark it down a bit in my opinion, the Mandalorian is still a very good minifigure, and you can easily make a Jango Fett MOC using their pieces. The jetpacks are the same as the ones on the Clones in the Corporate Alliance Tank Droid but grey instead of white, and the helmets are the same as Boba Fett's in the most recent Slave I but grey and blue instead of green and dark red. The rifle/turret is pretty cool too, and is easy for a minifigure to hold.

Speeder


The Mandalorian Speeder is pretty cool, and is very accurate to its Clone Wars appearance. It has a see-through 2x2x1
column2: cylindrical brick underneath it to give the impression that it is flying. One Mandalorian can be seated in it and it has no space to store accesories.
column3: font-size: 14px
column4: color: rgb(173, 24, 8)
column6:
"">

Turret


The Turret is a nice addition to this Battle Pack, and is built well. I find the gun
column7: swivels a little too easy though, and this can be a pain if your targeting a Clone and then suddenly you targeting your friend on the speeder.
column11:
"">

Pros and Cons


Pros:

  • - Mandalorians
  • - Speeder is Clone Wars accurate
  • - Turret
  • - Rifle/Turret
  • - Not many battle packs required because of all minifigures being the same
  •
column12:
Cons:

  • - No different minifigures (Mandalorian commander?..)


Price


Just like with the Clone Trooper Battle Pack, I think that $17.50 (NZD) is decent for a brand new Star Wars battle pack.

Overall


Overall I am pleased with this set and I would recommend it to most, however I probably wouldn't get many purely because there are no different minifigures, so you don't miss out on anything if you only get one battle pack.

",TRUE,5,5,4,5,5

column1:
AETerry,"2011-01-04T22:28:09.97Z","Mandalorian Review","

It's not very often that Lego Star Wars has a compelling set that gets my interest. I didn't just buy one, I bought two sets of this and I may, as part of army building, buy more as the year progresses.

The 4 minifigures are the Mandalorian Death Watch Soldiers, which I guess appear in the Clone Wars t.v. series. That explains the styling of their faces. And a good thing they have those snazzy blue Mandalorian helmets, otherwise they look highly sleep deprived and angry about it too. They feature a blue &
column2: grey coloring scheme for their armor, grey backpacks and each of them has at least one weapon they can carry.

column1: Before I go onto the rest of the set, I should mention one of the weapons carried is that classic video camera/bazooka piece with a minibuild for it so it's a tripod heavy laser cannon.
The Speeder Bike is
column2: a solid little build with a clear brick underneath to give the illusion it's hovering. Complementing the Mandalorians, it too is a blue &amp
column3: grey design.

column1: Finishing out this set is a Weapons Turrent, also a blue &

As someone who isn't all -that- familiar with every nuance of Star Wars or LEGO Star Wars, this is a great and wonderful little set. Obviously, if you've been collecting, just starting out, pick up random sets here and there... this set is well worth picking up.

",TRUE,5,5,5,5,5

CapnRex101,"2010-12-29T17:51:09.99Z","7914 - Mandalorian Battle Pack","

This is another brilliant
column3: from the January 2011 wave of Lego Star Wars, not quite as good as the Clone Trooper Battle Pack but still very good indeed.

column1:
Box/Instructions

The box art for this set is spectacular much like that of the Clone Trooper Battle Pack with the turret and speeder surrounded by Mandalorians and blaster fire. The box is the same size as all of the other battle packs as you might expect.

The instructions are faultless, as usual, and I had no missing pieces, in fact I had an extra Mandalorian helmet!

Parts

There are some nice pieces in this set such as of course the Mandalorian helmet (which with just a single sticker could be turned into that of Pre Vizsla) which you get four of or in my case five! The piece which connects the barrel of the turret to the stand may be a new
column3: as although I have not seen it in a set before, it could well be a piece I have simply not noticed. This set also includes some new pistols, these are basically the old pistols which came with the ARC trooper armour crossed with the basic short Star Wars blaster. They also appear in the Bounty Hunter Gunship and the new Clone Trooper Battle Pack.

column1:
Minifigures

The Minifigures in this set are the stand out feature for me! The helmets are very good and are very accurate to those seen in the television show. The torso printing is quite good and features a fair amount of detail as well. The jetpack is the same piece as seen in the Corporate Alliance Tank Droid but has been recoloured in dark grey.

The build

The build for this set is very short taking only five to ten minutes like the Clone Trooper Battle Pack. The build is very straightforward and easy, and utilises no new or interesting building techniques as far as I can see.

The completed model

Overall the model looks brilliant. The light turret looks really good, and could double as a chain gun or rotary cannon (still holding out for a piece for that). The heavier turret also looks quite good but perhaps needs something else at the front instead of just that blue piece. It just makes the armour look a bit weak. The speeder is lovely, very accurate to the episodes it appears in and very well designed.But it
column3: the figures that take the set up a level.&nbsp

column1:
Summary

Overall I feel this set could do with a couple of touches here and there but even without any modifications this is really a wonderful set. I think it would make a nice small gift for any Lego or Star Wars fan (including yourself) and would advise people to buy it. I hope to get a couple more of these and create a small Death Watch army to take on the might of the Republic and their valiant Clone troopers.


Overall - 9/10

",TRUE,5,5,4,4,5

column1: sudorum,"2011-02-09T20:30:33.76Z","Jango Fett Served Four Ways","This is the first and only battle pack I truly wanted the first time I heard of it. The fact that it was going to feature mandalorians instead of clones or rebels signified to me a much needed change. The only disappointing aspect about this battle pack is that all of the mandalorians are the same color. Also, they are very close resemblances to what an improved version of Jango Fett would look like. As in all battle packs, the minifigures are the center of the set. The turret and the strange vehicle neither hinder, nor help the set. They're just kind of there.&nbsp
column2:
,FALSE,3,4,1,1,4 Brickmeister1138","2011-01-24T22:24:25.05Z","When Battle Droids are not enough, it is time to send in the Mando'ade!","

This set is epic.
column3: It finally gives one the ability to add some Mandos to a Lego battle scene that are NOT based on parts lifted&nbsp
column4: from a&nbsp
column5: Boba or Jango minifigure. This set, like the Clone Battle Pack, is compsoed of multiple elements:

column1: The Mandalorians: In the Star Wars Universe, there are few forces more feared than the Mandalorian Supercommandos, and Lego has certainly given them justice in this set. The details are fantastic, and Lego even captured the intimidating look of the Mandalorian Armor (or beskar'gam if you are a Star Wars fan). Though the thing that puzzles me with this battle pack is the fact that the Mandos appear to be Clones. I do find it ironic that the CLONE TROOPER battle pack's troopers had more individuality than the Mandalorians in this set.

The Speeder: The speeder captures the look of the speeder used by Obi Wan and Duchess Satine in ""The Mandalore Plot"" episode of the Clone Wars. It is a simple build, but it was a simple speeder in the episode, so I have no compliants.

The Cannon + Repeater Rifle: These features of the set add to the playability, but are of little use to one going for movie accuracy. These componenets of the set are average, and I found them to be of little use.
Pros
<ul>
<li>The Mandalorians Look Awesome!
<li>The Speeder is movie accurateand well built
<li>4 Jet Packs
• The face on the mandos (though repeated) is well done and is easily useable elsewhere (it makes a great head for an Imperial Officer)
Cons
<ul>
<li>The Mandalorians appear to be clones, some individuality like in the Hoth Battle Packs would have been nice.
<li>A commander (Governor Vizsla for example) with different armor would have been Welcome
<li>The Cannon and Repeater Blaster are a little silly
<li>A little Expensive

This set, despite its slight flaws, is very well made and is truly a sight to behold. It is a must have for any Star Wars fan, and is an excellent Mandalorian Armor source (Mandalorian armor is the height of fashion amongst mercenaries and bounty hunters)
column3:
army builder. Overall I give this set a 4.75/5. The .25 was taken off because Mandos are not supposed to be clones.

",TRUE,5,5,3,4,4

column1:
lesar3,"2011-01-31T12:28:05.19Z","Mandalorians Woohoo!","

New Mandalorian Battlepack!

Box/Instructions

Box is small like all battlepack boxes nothing special on it, instructions too, nothing new

Parts

Set contains 68 pieces, no new pieces, most of them are in blue and grey, nothing special on them

Minifigures

4 mandalorians, they all look same, but they are very good designed, torso has printing on only one side, but that's not problem 'cause jetpack covers their back. Helmets are same like new Boba Fett's only in different color. Only bad thing about figures are their faces-they are ugly, even worse than clone faces

The build

Nothing special.. very easy to build, 5 min. max.

The completed model

The speeder is kinda stupid, it's too small, but it can maybe be useful in MOCs

Small turret is is pretty cool, it's very useful in almost every SW MOC, it can be attached to Mandalorian hand

Big turrent is also great, simple but nicely designed, it's also very useful in MOCs

Summary

It's pretty good set, playability is not very good (unless mandalorians fight with each other)

But most of people buy battlepacks only for minifigures.

Figs are great it could be of course better if even one of them is different but it's not so big problem...

If you have opportunity I think you should buy this set

I'll give it 8/10

",TRUE,4,2,3,3,5

column1:
tommy216a,"2011-07-20T11:18:30.603Z","Not worth $12","

This summer, I am starting to rebuild all of my Lego sets, so I should be writing more reviews soon. I am starting with this one, The Mandalorian Battle Pack, Set #7914.

Box/Instructions

The box has the Captian Rex logo on it and shows off the set and the 4 new mandos. And on the back, it shows this set in battle with Set #7913(The Clone Trooper Battle Pack). The instructions show all the new Lego Star Wars Sets from the 2011 Winter Line.

Parts

You get a cool Mixture of blue and gray pieces in this set which is very nice. There is a new Machine gun turret design for one of the Mandos as well. I count the minifigure parts in the rating.

Minifigures

The 4 Mandalorians
column2: are very cool. You can easily customize one of them as Jango Fett, Pre Vizla, or any other Mando that comes to mind. Besides the new machine gun for one of the&nbsp
column3: Mandos, you also get a blaster pistol, blaster rifle, and 2 new commando pistols.

column1:
The build

The build is about 5 minutes long and not very hard.

The completed model

The Blaster Turret has a new design(it is different from the one in the old clone trooper battle pack back in 2007) and turns 360 degrees without a minifig manning it very easily. The Mando Speeder Bike also has a very cool design. It has a little blaster on the front for shooting.

Summary

This set is a must have for big Star Wars fans, mando-lovers, or if you will get every single Lego Star Wars Battle Pack(like me). But if you are none of the above, this set is not worth $12. To make it worth $12, it needs to have 1-2 more mandos or another speeder. Overall, I give this set a 4 out of 5.

",TRUE,4,5,3,3,3

legoman831,"2011-12-08T21:09:43.51Z","The Clone Army's Next Challenge: The Mandalorians","

This is the review of the LEGO STAR WARS 7914 Mandalorian Battle Pack which has 68 pieces to build 4 minifigures with 5 weapons, a turret, and a speeder for $11.99.
column2: The price per ratio may be very high
column3: however, you do get some great-looking minifigures which have good value.&nbsp
column4: Overall, it is a worth-while set to get.&nbsp

column1: <h4>The Build.&nbsp
The build was extremely easy, for it took 4.5 minutes to build with no mistakes in the instructions.
<h4>The Parts.&nbsp
I do like the blue parts in the set. You also get two wings pieces and nice scopes and a clear piece.
<h4>The Minifigures.&nbsp
You
column2: get 4 Mandalorians which are excellent blue figures with no back printing.&nbsp
column3: They have great mold and printing for helmet.&nbsp
column4: They have a gray single jetpack and a good detailed torso.&nbsp
column5: The long gun, small gun, two small pistols, and a very cleverly-designed machine gun come with these guys.&nbsp
column6: These minifigures will go for $5-$15 each and $15 to $20 for 4 of each online.&nbsp

column1: <h4>The Ships.&nbsp
The set comes with a speeder and a turret which both have great-looking color schemes.
column2: The speeder with a 2x2x2 clear brick piece&nbsp
column3: is very sleek and good-looking all around.&nbsp
column4: The minifigure can sit on a 2x2 brick space&nbsp
column5: where his hands can attach to the steering controls.&nbsp
column6: The wings on the sides can move up and down.&nbsp
column8: I love way the LEGO Company made the front and tail of the speeder.&nbsp
column9: It looks brilliant along with turrent's front.&nbsp
column10: You can put a minifigure on a 2x2 brick space.&nbsp
column11: The gun can move a 360 degree rotation.&nbsp
column12: Overall, the ships are great, but the problem with this set is the fact that the playability is limited, until you buy the 7913 Clone Trooper Battle Pack for Clone Troopers to battle.&nbsp

column1: <h4>The Value.&nbsp
The price-per-ratio is bad because it is 17 cents per piece.
column2: It should have been $6.99 with the price-per-ratio being 10 cents.&nbsp
column3: However, I do like the stuff you get in the set.&nbsp
column4: Overall, it is worth picking up.&nbsp

column1: The Summary.
In conclusion, this set has 4 excellent minifigures, 5 essential guns, 1 awesome speeder, and 1 cool turret which is 68 pieces
column3: It is a great buy.&nbsp
column4: You will not be dissatisified.&nbsp
column5: But if you are build a Mandalorian army, you need to get it on a BOGO50% discount.&nbsp
column6: Comparing to the 7913 Clone Trooper Battle Pack, I get this first because we have never gotten any Mandalorian except Jango Fett and Boba Fett before.&nbsp
column7: But if you want an army of something, get the 7913 for more pieces and cooler minifigures.&nbsp
column9: If you want more playability, buy both this and 7913 for $23.98 which is pretty good for playability and 8 minifigures.&nbsp

column1:
fox171171,"2011-03-23T12:29:48.83Z","Great army building set","

This is an awesome army building set.
Pros
<ul>
• Great for army building
• Nice weapons assortment
Cons
<ul>
• Found it hard to seat minifig on the speeder without parts coming off
• Bipod gun can't be held straight
• Around 20 cents (Canadian) per piece before tax is a little steep

I can see that if you were only to get one of these sets, it would be nice to get a Pre Vizsla figure. However, I also feel that would harm the army building potential of the set. I wanted to build a small army, and ending up with fewer generic figures and several repeats of a "
column3: figure would have impeded that goal.

column1: Whenever I try to seat a minifigure on the speeder, I end up with pieces popping off while trying to get it in just the right position. Once positioned properly, it seems fine.
The bipod gun is pretty cool, but can't be positioned straight out from the minifigure. The angle of the box art makes it appear to be, but it is not.
http://www.brickshelf.com/gallery/fox171171/Star-Wars/star-wars-minifig/mandalorian-with-bipod-gun.jpg

I have two of these sets, and may pick up one more. I am pleased with it.

",TRUE,4,4,4,4,4
The_Guy_With_The_Bricks,"2011-05-12T10:36:09.29Z","Lego ""Mandies"" Battle Pack - A Great Army Builder","<span style=""color: black
column2:
>Proof that The Lego Group does listen to its fans in creating set designs, the new Lego Mandalorian Battle Pack, released alongside the 7913 Clone Trooper Battle Pack, represents one of the most requested Lego Star Wars designs finally come to reality. This is a great set, with a fun speeder and large cannon.

For my full review including more pictures, please visit www.brick-building-ideas.com/lego-mandalorian.html.

[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/28524159/Star%20Wars/mandalorianbattlepack.jpg[/img]
column3:
>
Below is a picture of Boba Fett with the Mandalorians from the Battle pack. I believe this picture was taken at the yearly Mandalorian Family reunion.

[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/28524159/Star%20Wars/bobaandsomemandys.jpg[/img]

The Lego Mandalorian Battle Pack is a great addition to the Star Wars Lego line. We have been waiting and asking for a representation of the Mandalorian armor outside of the Jango Fett and Boba Fett figures, and here it is! The helmet and jet pack are separated, in the fashion of the recent Lego Boba Fett from the 2010 rerelease of the Slave I (set 8097). In the earlier sets, the helmet and jetpack for Boba and Jango were one piece. The new design looks more realistic and allows for flexibility in the neck for these figures.

[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/28524159/Star%20Wars/mandywithouthelmet.jpg[/img]

One of the slight disappointments of this set is the lack of a difference between the four Mandalorian figures. They are all exactly the same, as opposed to the many variations of the Clone troopers like the ones from the recent Clone Battle Pack. Hopefully we will get more Mandalorian sets in the future (the Mandalorian league “Death Watch” has become more significant in the recent “Clone Wars” TV episodes) and will have more variations on the Mandalorian figure design. Another strange thing is that the faces are all exactly the same, just like the Clone Troopers. Someone should point out to the Lego designers that the Mandalorians are not clones, but this really is a minor quibble.

It’s great to see Lego responding to its fan base with the production of sets. The 7914 Mandalorian Battle Pack is a fabulous addition to any Lego Star Wars collection. Pick up one today! And don't forget to check out my full review here!
column4:
>
[img]http://dl.dropbox.com/u/28524159/Star%20Wars/mandysvsclonies.jpg[/img]

Yes, I know that Boba Fett shouldn't be fighting a Clone War battle alongside the Mandalorians. Don't freak out on me, guys.

column1:
,TRUE,4,5,3,5,4 Firox_5000","2012-01-07T16:46:52.93Z","Blue mandolorian team","

This is the second battle pack of the 2011 series and comes with 4 figures, 68 pieces and cost me £9.99 when bought [ now £11.99].The set takes an average time of 10 minutes
column2: to build and to most lego fans should be very easy construction.

column1: The set comes with four figures all of which are blue mandalorians. The figures themselves like most battle packs are the key feature and have beutifal printing on the helmet and chest. All mandalorians are packed with different sized guns some being very small and on having a big gun.

The set contains a range of small accesseries and vehicles for the mandolians to battle with. The main object is a small winged flying vehicle which can hold one mandalorian figure on top which looks like a nicely sized vehicle. Another accesserie is a turret stand where one mandalorian can take aim and fire out at clone trooper which in my view is a great addition to the battle pack due to the variaiton of vehicles it offers [ which often appears in most battle packs]. There is also a smaller
column2: gun turret included however this one in my view has not been as well done due to it's punyness. Apart from that, it has a very nice range of accesseries which are all excellent additions to the battle pack.

column1: The set parts are of a very good standard with the helmet and armour printing on the figures being superb. the set also has common [but useful] other parts such as wings, a car tyre hub blue curved wedge and long black tube brick.
The playability on it's own is fairly durable but when conbined with the Clone battle pack makes the play value far more durable when theyre together.

For £9.99 [ now £11.99] the sets value for money is of a reasonable value however the piece count and size of the battle pack is quite small in comparison to others of its price and size. For it's currently higher price of £11.99 though, the price is too high and has just over half the parts a size for this price should have. The set shouldve stayed at £9.99 as it's a much better price.

Overall, I recommend this set to all star wars fans, army builders and any general lego fan for the figures and supporting accesseries.

",TRUE,5,5,3,4,3

Jarod98,"2011-05-05T08:11:44.23Z","7914-1: Mandalorian Battle Pack","I got this set at Target a while ago for only $8, and boy did I make the right move there! I rated 'Playability' 4 stars because even though there's only Mandalorians I have hundreds of other figs that fit right in (like Clone Troopers and Jedi). Huge_Nerd,"2011-02-24T15:07:18.46Z","Mandalorious!","

I got this set for relatively cheap at a Borders during their going out of business sale. I really like the look of the Mandalorians--I've always been a fan of the Fetts. I'm not too familiar with the Clone Wars show, but I would have liked some variation in color like the comic books' Mando armies. The blue ""pops"" nicely though.
column2: Also, their faces are pretty ugly, but that's why they have helmets!

column1: I like the fact that they have three little models to interact with. The turret station, tripod gun, and speeder provide more playability and posing options than a single larger vehicle. The clear piece on the speeder somewhat hidden by the speeder's wings give it a nice illusion of hovering. There's also a nice variety of guns included.
In conclusion, this is a fun little set. You can army build with multiple sets or use
column3:
as an elite squad of mercenaries like I do (I use the assassin droid pack the same way).

Duckuss_Maxximus,"2011-04-22T07:16:54.103Z","Jango Fett would be rolling in his grave...U.U","

This set never really appealed to me when it first came out. Really all I wanted was one of the minifigs. I did end up picking one of these up eventually mainly because Wal-Mart has been teeming with these sets for a while. For the most part everything was pretty easy to build. There's really nothing too special to the speeder or the turret. There is quite a bit of variety for weaponry in this pack although the bi-pod gun doesn't really hold right unless you have it at an angle.. The Pre Vizsla minifig head is ugly as sin. I never really cared for the clone's faces much either but these guys are just down right creepy-looking...*shudder* Anyway, I feel there wasn't much uniqueness to set them apart. A Boba-style cape, helmet markings and the black lightsaber would've been cool for the Deathwatch leader Vizsla as in the picture below.
Pros

• *Weaponry
  • *Updated Jango Fett (if you have the right parts)
  • *Mandalorian army builder (i say modify em)
Cons

• *Pre Vizsla's face
  • *Must angle the bi-pod just right to get it to stand right
  • *Not enough uniqueness to the minifigs

Over all I'd say swap out a Boba face from the new Slave-I or a clone even and just make an updated version of Jango and either mod the other minifigs or keep em as spares or sell em/give em away...

",TRUE,3,3,2,3,2

,TRUE,4,4,3,3,4 KLOKRIECHER","2012-02-19T08:07:06.21Z","LEGO Star Wars - Mandalorian Battle Pack Review","

Parts

Minifigures

All minifigs look the same but they're still cool, because they remind me a lot of Jango Fett.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and there're also no stickers included in this set.

The completed model

This set has a lot of stuff in it: We get a nice looking cannon, a great turret and a speeder. The clear piece underneath the speeder should pretend that this vehicle is flying. I think it's a good army builder, because you get a lot of weapons for any army you want to build.

Summary

All
in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get
this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.

Odeinoichus,"2012-10-27T18:28:09.85Z","Mandos on the March","

Set #7914 Mandalorian Battle Pack: After years of Star Wars themed sets, with only a bare few of them featuring our favorite Mandalorian Bounty Hunter Boba and to my knowledge only one set featuring Jango his father, LEGO brings us something Star Wars fans had been itching for, for years.
The Mandalorian Battle Pack, much like the Clone
column2: Troopers Battle Pack features four Mini-Figures and a small build, while the Clones only had one model in the BARC Speeder, the Mandos got two smaller models. Fast and easy to build, both models enhance the play value of this set.

column1: The first model is a small gun station, designed for defensive perimeters the gun station is manned by one of the Mandos. We've seen gun stations before, with other Clone sets, this and the other model however are all uniform in color. With blues and greys matching the tones of the Mini-Figures themselves, these models are all uniform in nature and look great, especially in multiples. (Or with the new Mandalorian Starfighter.)
The second model is a fairly small
column2: speeder vehicle used by the Mando Commander, or Captain, considering the Mando given the speeder carries the small pistol accessories Clone Captains and Commanders use. This model is a fun little number for kids, for adults it's more of an afterthought that adds to displays and dioramas.

column1: You build a third item, not much of a build really, taking some pieces and a Mini-Figure accessory you create a special weapon for one of the Mando Mini-Figures, a sort of dual-legged assault blaster/sniper weapon.

The Mini-Figures are perfect looking, with uniform colors of dark blue and gray they evoke the Mandalorian design from the Clone Wars Cartoon. Unfortunately none of these Mandos have double-sided torsos. A minor complaint, as the detail work is very impressive on the prints, and considering they are also wearing the brand new jetpack piece for the Mandalorian armor back printing would have been wasted on them.

The new helmet piece is quite nice too, and the faces, while all identical, have the Clone Wars aesthetic. The assortment of weapons included are mostly found in other sets with Clones, but they work just as good here as they do in those other sets. Overall this is a must have set, a much appreciated troop builder style set for those of you who want to army build Mandos. And they complement Pre Vizslaw's set quite nicely. The only thing missing from this set honestly are the viewfinders found on Mando helmets, the helmets themselves have two tiny holes in the side for such a piece, but for whatever reason LEGO did not include them. Still I highly reccomend this set to every LEGO Star Wars fan.

",TRUE,5,5,4,5,5

Chills,"2012-05-08T08:52:45.483Z","The Mandalorians are coming.","

My new brother-in-law gave me this set as a wedding gift. He said I had too many Imperials and needed other minifigures in my collection. He is absolutely right! 4 Mandalorians and a speeder, a turret gun, and what appears to be a sniper rifle. All necessary pieces of equipment for a proper army.
Pros

<ul><li>Pro 1: I like the minifigures. While I'm not the biggest Mandalorian fan, these figures are a good addition to a collection. They are pretty detailed and even have angry battle-faces. I like the blue and grey color scheme
column2:
it separates them from Boba Fett and the all the Imperial figures I have.
  • Pro 2: The speeder and the turret are pretty cool. LEGO can't do anything too elaborate because the main reason for the set is the minifigures, but they did a decent job with these two models
column3: both have good playability.

column1: Cons

• Con 1: All the minifigures are the same. In the other battle packs you get a variety, but here you have 4 blue/grey Mandalorians. LEGO advertises that one is an assassin, but there's nothing to differentiate that figure from the others.
  • Con 2: Price. Though this isn't an expensive set the price per piece is pretty high. If LEGO could drop it a few $ then I think the set would be a better value.

Overall I'm pleased with this set. The turret and the speeder are neat and the 4 Mandalorians look pretty cool next to all the stormtroopers in my collection. Battle packs are supposed to be inexpensive ways to build your minifigure armies, which this does. If you're a Clone Wars fan and need to build up your army grab one of these sets.

",TRUE,4,3,3,4,3

alfred_the_buttler,"2021-01-23T06:03:50.6Z","Only worth it for the minifigures ","

So I already owned a couple of the Mandalorian minifigures that I picked up over the years, but was thinking that since I'
column2: m buying all the Mando sets from the show, maybe I ought to have this set as well, and it is very cheap to piece it together on Bricklink if you aren&#39
column3: t buying the minifigures.&nbsp

column1: Minifigures

You get four identical Death Watch minifigures in this set. Certainly they lack the detail and variety of the new Mandalorian battle pack, yet, they are perfect for anyone who is trying to put together a battle from the Clone Wars. They also make a decent stand-in for Bo-Katan and her friends that appeared with her on the new show. Obviously, they are all male and lack details, but at least they are the right colors. Until Lego releases a new set with these characters, these will be your best bet.
The Builds

This is perhaps the most disappointing thing about this set. You get two tiny, super simple builds (3 if you count the heavy artillery). First is a speeder. This is the same design as the speeder in the newer Mandalorian battle pack, only much simpler and it hovers on a clear cylinder. Quite honestly, my kids could design much better speeders, and they'
column2: d be a lot sturdier too.&nbsp

column1: You also get a bunker with a cannon that is equally simple. The best part about it is the rather unique piece that the cannon is built off of. Again, this type of build was copied in the newer battle pack and with much more detail.
Finally, if you can consider it a build, you get a portable cannon that is compromised of 6 pieces, centered around one of those old cameras that appeared in Classic Space.
The Verdict

Seeing how the newer set is still available in stores, there is zero reason to get this set anymore, unless you like the color scheme better. If that is the case, may I suggest purchasing the bricks for the new set in the colors of this set so that you have better and more substantial models. This set is really only worth it for the minifigures, and assuming we start getting Bo-Katan and other Mandalorians in the not too distant future, even the minifigures may not be worth it for much longer.
,TRUE,3,2,1,3,2 Captainfives1514","2022-12-21T21:09:57.543Z","Mandalorians Death Watch","
column2: This is one of my favorite battle packs of all time, I must say starting off this review. I was given this set for Christmas back in 2011. That started my Mandolorian obsession.&nbsp

column1: &nbsp
&nbsp
column2: The minifigures in this set are all the same four identical Mandolorian warriors. They all wear the same Mandolorian helmet in dark grey with a black visor and blue and white accents. There torsos are printed with Mandalorian armor over dark blue shirt and a brown and gray belt. There faces are Clone Wars style printing with exaggerated features. There legs are blue with grey hips. They all wear grey jet packs. One carries a blaster rifle. The other carries a regular blaster. Another one carries two blaster pistols. The final warrior is unarmed.

The first thing you build is a long range blaster for the unarmed Mando. Second thing you build is a one man turret for another warrior. This construction has the most interesting piece in the set. This piece is&nbsp
column3: to make up the base for the blaster cannon that you mount on the base. The final and most complex build is the speeder bike for a&nbsp
column4: Mando to ride.

column2: Overall this is an excellent set and one of the best battle packs ever produced in my humble opinion.
